gate.subTitle: A system that stores logs that occur while you're using NAVER CLOUD PLATFORM's services and provides analytics data about them.
gate.subTitleDescription:
Store logs that occur while you're using NAVER CLOUD PLATFORM's services including Server and analyze them.
Lookup and download log data you need, to effectively manage logs.
gate.describeTag04: Various additional features (to be provided later)

validate.customDefault: The field must be a valid value.
validate.customIn: The field must be a valid value.
validate.customMax: The field may not be greater than {param} characters.
validate.customMin: The field must be at least {param} characters.
validate.customMaxValue: The field must be less than {param}.
validate.customMinValue: The field must be more than {param}.
validate.customExt: The field must be a valid {param} file.
validate.customSize: The file size must be less than {param}KB.
validate.namePattern: Only English alphabet, numbers and underscore (_) are allowed.
validate.numEn: Only allowed English, numbers, special characters '-' and must begin with English.
validate.numEnKorea: Only allowed English, Korean, numbers, special characters '-' and must begin with English.

error404.title: Resource Not Found
error404.desc_1: The page cannot be displayed due to an invalid page address or internal error.
error404.desc_3: Please check if the address you entered is correct.
error404.desc_4: If the problem persists, contact our Help Center (1544-5876).

error403.title: Forbidden Error
error403.desc_1: This sub account is not authorized and can not be operated.
error403.desc_2: Please contact your Sub Account representative to request additional MANAGER or Action privileges for your product.

error401.title: Request Error
error401.desc_1: The page cannot be displayed due to an invalid page address or internal error.
error401.desc_3: Please check if the address you entered is correct.
error401.desc_4: If the problem persists, contact our Help Center (1544-5876).

error500.title: Internal Server Error
error500.desc_1: The page cannot be displayed due to an invalid page address or internal error.
error500.desc_3: Please check if the address you entered is correct.
error500.desc_4: If the problem persists, contact our Help Center (1544-5876).

error.errorMessage:
Please try again later.
The service is temporarily unavailable.
If this failure persists, contact our Help Center.

home.description: Please log in again to continue using the service.
home.apply-p-1: You don’t have a subscription to Cloud Log Analytics.
home.apply-p-2: Please click [Request] to request the Cloud Log Analytics service.
home.release-p-1: Click [Disable Product] to cancel your subscription to Cloud Log Analytics.
home.release-p-2: If you agree to cancel it, the service is no longer provided,
home.release-p-3: and all the data saved while you’re using the service will be also deleted.
home.release-p-4: Before canceling the service, you should delete the settings and the agents you've installed to avoid unnecessary traffic.
home.modal-tips-1: Your request has been successfully submitted.
home.modal-tips-2: All the data saved while you’re using the service will be deleted.

logSetting.title: Add log collection settings
logSetting.tips-1: Path/file access error. Please enter a valid log path.
logSetting.tips-2: The same log type/path already exists.
logSetting.tips-3: Only lowercase English alphabet and underscroe (_) are allowed, and it can be up to 20 characters in length.
logSetting.tips-4: Select a template, and it is automatically added. If you select [Custom log], enter a log type and log path and click [Add].
logSetting.feesInfo: Cloud Log Analytics fee is charged by combining the log storage fee and API call fee.

settingGuide.title: How to install the CLA agent in your server
settingGuide.desc-1: The log collection settings have been added.
settingGuide.desc-2: In order to start collecting logs, you should install the agent in your servers as described below.
settingGuide.desc-3: Please note that logs are not collected from your servers with no agents installed even if you've configured log collection settings on the console.
settingGuide.step-1-1: Log in to your server from which you want to collect logs.
settingGuide.step-1-2: For more information on how to connect to servers, refer to "
settingGuide.step-2-1: Execute the "command to install the log collection agent" shown below. Click [Copy to clipboard] to easily copy the command.
settingGuide.step-2-2: Command to install the log collection agent
settingGuide.step-3-1: When the "command to install the log collection agent" is executed in your server, the agent is automatically downloaded, installed and set up.
settingGuide.step-3-2: When the agent has been successfully installed, the following message is displayd.
settingGuide.step-4-1: Check if logs are successfully collected from the server in the Dashboard page of Cloud Log Analytics.
settingGuide.step-4-2: If logs are not collected, check if an error occurred while installing the agent and go back to Step 2.

deleteGuide.title: How to stop collecting logs from your servers
deleteGuide.desc-1: The log collection settings have been deleted.
deleteGuide.desc-2: In order to stop collecting logs from your servers, you must remove the log collection agent from your servers.
deleteGuide.desc-3: Please note that the agent still running in your server can cause unnecessary traffic even if you've disabled the log collection settings on the console.
deleteGuide.step-1-1: Log in to your server from which logs have been collected.
deleteGuide.step-1-2: For more information on how to connect to servers, refer to "
deleteGuide.step-2-1: Execute the "command to remove the log collection agent" shown below. Click [Copy to clipboard] to easily copy the command.
deleteGuide.step-2-2: Command to remove the log collection agent
deleteGuide.step-3-1: "When the "command to remove the log collection agent" is executed in your server, the agent is automatically removed from your server and logs are no longer collected.
deleteGuide.step-3-2: When the agent has been successfully removed, the following message is displayed.

noserverDialog.title: User Guide
noserverDialog.p-2-1: Create a server first, and then click [Add settings] to start the Cloud Log Analytics service.

notApplyDialog.title: User Guide
notApplyDialog.p-1: Cloud Log Analytics helps you collect and store logs from various NAVER CLOUD PLATFORM services including Server as well as user-defined logs to easily view and analyze them.
notApplyDialog.p-2: Please click [Request] to request the CLA service.

cdbVerifyDialog.title: Notice
cdbVerifyDialog.p: Only allowed English, numbers, special characters '-' and must begin with English

dashboard.error-1: An error occurred while getting data.
dashboard.error-2: It could be a temporary problem or a network issue. Please try again later. If the problem persists, contact our Help Center.

exportlog.autoMsg:
Export search results to Object Storage.
Select the target bucket to be exported, and if no bucket has been created
Please first create a bucket from the Object Storage product.
The exported file is saved in the CLAExport folder of the selected bucket.
exportlog.off-1: Existing auto export information will be released and will be applied from the next day.
exportlog.off-2: if you want to cancel, please click on the Cancel Setting button.
exportlog.logSucMsg: Auto export setting is turned off.

search.tips-1: Input error. The start time must be before the end time.
search.error-2: This page is displayed for the following reason.
search.error-3: - Too many search results (more than 10,000 results)
search.error-4: Refine your search by changing the search criteria.

objectStorage.tip-1:
If you want to use Object Storage, you need to prepare an API authorization key.
You can create an API authorization key in the portal> My Page> Manage Accounts> Manage Authentication Keys menu.
objectStorage.tip-2: Set the type of log to export and the target bucket. (The created bucket must exist before it can be configured)
objectStorage.tip-3: Automatically export data from the next day based on when the setting is completed.
objectStorage.tip-4: The exported file is saved by creating a folder by date in the target bucket.
objectStorage.sendResultTip-1: Export Object Storage is being executed normally.
objectStorage.sendResultTip-2: You can check the in-progress Log from Export Log.
objectStorage.sendResultTip-3: There are too many users in the system.
objectStorage.sendResultTip-4: Please try it again after a while.
